page.title: 02FARMING
page.content: Typical of others in the D-Block is C----- Farm,Stalham. With limited live stock(14 calves for fattening) its 230 acres are largely devoted to arable: 100 to wheat, 30 to peas for canning and 43 to sugar beet for processing at Cantley. The remaining acreage is for home use. Machinery used includes a combine harvester,four main tractors, two "running about"tractors, a potato planter, a large sprayer,a cultivator and a beet drill. In 1871,it took ten men and four boys to work the land i.e. one man to 20 acres.In 1965, just five men were employed i.e. one man to 46 acres. Today just 2 are employed:one man to 115 acres.
